definition: to tear open/to tear down/to tear apart/to open
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

sentences.english: The X-ray shows a fractured ankle.
sentences.chinese: 一周之后再来，我给你拆线。

sentences.english: Come back in a week and I’ll take your stiches out.
sentences.chinese: 一周之后再来，我给你拆线。

sentences.english: You must make marks clearly when the wires are disconnected.
sentences.chinese: 拆线时，你必须清楚地做下记号。

sentences.english: Come back in a week and I'll take your stiches out.
sentences.chinese: 一周之后再来，我给你拆线。

sentences.english: Then select the "stitches" layer again so that it is the active layer.
sentences.chinese: 再次，它是活性层，然后选择“拆线”层。

sentences.english: This will add more depth and dimension to the stitches.
sentences.chinese: 这将增加更多的深度和维度拆线。

definition: to reduce swelling/detumescence/(fig.) to streamline (a bloated bureaucracy etc)
to form a scar/to form a scab
to sew together/suture (in surgery)/to sew up (a wound)
general anesthetic/abbr. for 全身麻醉
to give or have an injection
to leave hospital/to be discharged from hospital
